bluejam.string

Class SuffixArray

  • bluejam.string.SuffixArray

  • public class SuffixArray

    A suffix array (SA) constructed with O(n) times where n is the length of a string.

    This implementation of SA contains an empty suffix. That is the first element of SA is always n. More precisely, this class adds \0 (null character) to the end of a string same as lots of articles add $ to a string. So, if you pass a string contains \0, this implementation might fail.

    • Field Detail

      • Companion

        public static bluejam.string.SuffixArray.Companion Companion

    • Constructor Detail

      • SuffixArray

        public SuffixArray(@NotNull
                   java.lang.String s)

        A suffix array (SA) constructed with O(n) times where n is the length of a string.

        This implementation of SA contains an empty suffix. That is the first element of SA is always n. More precisely, this class adds \0 (null character) to the end of a string same as lots of articles add $ to a string. So, if you pass a string contains \0, this implementation might fail.

    • Method Detail

      • getLength

        public int getLength()

        The length of the original string.

      • getSa

        @NotNull
public kotlin.Array[] getSa()

        The suffix array. The i-th element indicates the i-th smallest suffix starts from sa[i].

      • getRank

        @NotNull
public kotlin.Array[] getRank()

        The inverse array of SA. Indicates a suffix starts from i is the rank[i]-th smallest suffix.

      • getLcp

        @NotNull
public kotlin.Array[] getLcp()

        The longest common prefix array. The length of a common prefix of i-th smallest suffix and i + 1-th smallest suffix is lcp[i].

      • getS

        @NotNull
public java.lang.String getS()
